comment: So much extra credit. There are 4 tests, top 3 are chosen with highest grade as 40%, other two grades for 30% each. I had a 98 going into the final so I didn't show up to class after the 3rd test. Very easy and I learned a lot. She is a great teacher. YOU DO NOT NEED THE BOOK AT ALL!!! Don't buy the book, I didn't touch it once.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Such a great professor and class. She is super sweet and always willing to help. Tests arent bad and neither are any assignments. Lots of extra credit opportunity!!

Hands down best teacher I have taken at Kennesaw. Super sweet and cares about the students. As long as you put work down on tests, you will get some sort of credit. Got a 100 and a 108 on the first 2 tests, because she loves to give extra credit for participating in review games. In-class quizzes, but she tells you what days. Go to class & get an A

This was by far the best experience I've had with a professor. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. This is shown by the amount of extra credit given and the way her grading system is set up. She wants the students to understand the material and really enjoys teaching it. Definitely take her if you get the chance!

Show up for class and you'll easily pass. Her notes were very clear and organized and she went through them in every class step-by-step. She also has a jeopardy review game prior to each exam which is also worth bonus points and it helps that she's easy on the eyes.
Take her if you can! She makes understanding the material very easy and puts all of the notes on D2L. If you go to class and study what she posts... its an easy A

I love taking Mrs. Rutherford class. I would take her class again. She makes sure you understand the material. Easy A, if you study your materials. Try not to skip class, pop quizzes is given in class and random extra points is given for people to stay for the whole class. Final exam is optional, it can take-over for the lowest test grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great teacher, if you take any time at all to get to know her, she will help you in any way possible to help you.  The class was difficult material, but she made it as clear as any teacher could and I was able to pull out an A. I would take her at all possible.
Best professor ever ! Took her for business statistics & macro Econ. Got As in both. She made stat so much easier for me to understand. Wish she taught more classes !

Dr. Rutherford is fantastic!  She really cares that you understand the concepts.  Her review Jeopardy game makes it a lot of fun to study for the exams.  The bonus points received from the review game was very generous.
Just a great professor! A class I wouldn't like normally she made it great.
rating_tags: Inspirational--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rutherford was an incredible instructor for this course. It's not an easy course, but she makes it about as easy as it can be. There were 3 tests and an optional final replacing your lowest test grade along with your top 5 quizzes. She gives credit for knowing the concepts and I highly recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very, very nice teacher, easy class to pass. Gives out 4 exams and drops the lowest graded exam. No final cumulative exam. Gives out extra credit points for attending class, on a couple of occasions, and also hosts jeopardy review games for extra credit points on the exam, GO TO THOSE. Got an extra 15 points on my exam cause of it. Highly recommend

She is very nice and really cares about her students. However, her lectures are very boring and gives 7 pop quizzes throughout the semester. I would take her again but just beware that you may need to visit her often during office hours for help. She isn't very clear on explaining things during class time. All exam problems come from notes.

Professor Rutherford was a great professor! If you struggle with econ, I highly suggest taking her! She drops the lowest test grade at the end of the semester and then your highest test grade is 40% and two lowest test grades are 30% each. She gives out a lot of extra credit so make sure to go to the Jeopardy review games!

Good professor. Wants you to do well. Grade is based off 4 exams, drops lowest. GO TO JEOPARDY REVIEW GAME! you can get points toward individual exam grade, helps in the long run. Attendance isnt mandatory & all lecture notes are on d2L. She gives study guides. Studying and the jeopardy game will save you! Economics is boring! Hard to pay attention

She really wants the students to do well. I have the utmost respect for this professor as she cares about the student body population and is very lenient on her grading. There is no final exam in the class and that made things a lot better for everyone. She gives you extra credit before the test if you play jeopardy !

The only grades are 4 tests, but she drops the lowest test and makes the highest grade 40% of your grade and the other two 30%. She does Jeopardy review games where you can earn extra credit, and she has other opportunities here and there. 86+ is an A in her class. Attendance isn't mandatory. Highly recommended if you suck at Econ.
4 Tests, No final. Drops lowest grade. LOTS OF EXTRA CREDIT! Review days are crucial! Sweetheart! I love and adore her! Must take again if offered! 86+ is an A

4 Exams. Drops the lowest one and makes the highest one 40% of your average. And oh yeah, she gives so much extra credit on review days.  I kid you not I went to only her class 5 times. For 3 exams and 2 review days.  I easily got a 100 in the class and finished before spring break. She's sweet, helpful, and committed to making her students succeed
PRETTY EASY CLASS just study the practice exams before the test and you will be fine. lots of bonus points. DO NOT BY THE BOOK

Only 4 tests, and she only counts 3 towards your final grade. The highest grade is 40% and the other 2 are worth 30%. She offers jeopardy the class before every test and if you win you can end up with tons of bonus points. It made one of my tests go from a C to an A. Class isn't mandatory, but I highly recommend going 1 or 2 times before the test.

4 tests and thats it. Drops lowest test grade and doubles highest test grade. 85-100 is an A. She isn't very good at explaining things and has a slight accent but if you read and do the practice problems you will be golden. Gives lots of extra credit. Jeopardy games can get you on average of 10 bonus points per test so go on Jeopardy days.

Take her! Easy A! 86 and above is an A plus she gives extra points on your final grade!  If you fail her class, college isn't for you. Easiest A you can get! She's super nice and loves the subject. No homework but she does post optional review that literally comes from her test bank. She gives you all of the resources, you just have to learn.

Very easy class. Material can be pretty tough, but has review sessions before each exam where you can earn  points towards the exam. Gives LOTS of extra credit. She doesn't always seem like she knows what she's talking about and can confuse you sometimes. Overall easy grade if you put in a little effort
I showed up for just the test days and recieved an A. Straight forward and respectable teacher. I would take her again.

The best professor  at KSU. It was such a joy to sit in her class and she makes her lectures as fun as possible. She's very understanding and wants all her students to succeed.  You do not have to come to class; however, this is one class you would regret missing. Very easy class and if you apply some effort.. It's an easy A! She is the best!
Only four tests, with the lowest one being dropped. She gives lots of extra credit and the powerpoints are all online.
